chatgpt_double_star.new_statement: Government should set a universal guarantee that no one is denied essential care or ruined financially by illness, while allowing people to choose among regulated public and private coverage options. It should focus on clear benefit standards, automatic enrollment, and straightforward income-based support, alongside strong oversight of pricing, quality, and fraud. By investing in prevention, primary care, and rural/community capacity—and paying for results rather than volume—this approach protects families, respects choice, and keeps costs sustainable.

chatgpt_double_star_rankings.new_statement: Government should guarantee universal access to an affordable, high-quality baseline of essential preventive, primary, mental-health, and emergency care, with strong protection against catastrophic costs and medical bankruptcy. Beyond that floor, regulated private and employer options should remain available to preserve patient choice and spur innovation, while coverage stays portable across jobs and life changes. Cost control should rely on transparent pricing, negotiated rates, streamlined administration, and anti-fraud oversight, paired with targeted subsidies and support for rural and community providers. Reforms should be phased in with clear standards, measurable outcomes, and fiscal accountability to sustain broad public trust.

chatgpt_double_star_personas.new_statement: Government should ensure every American has access to an affordable, basic package of essential care—especially primary, preventive, mental health, and emergency services—with strong protection from catastrophic bills and medical bankruptcy. To respect choice and differing views on government, people should be able to keep or buy regulated private coverage on top of that baseline, while public programs negotiate fair prices, require transparency, and reduce paperwork and fraud to control costs. Funding and standards should be fiscally responsible, measured by clear outcomes, and implemented with support for rural hospitals, community clinics, and local providers so care remains timely and accountable.
